title: Drawing, "Ceres is told of the Rape of Proserpina", 1812
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on light brown laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: la ninfa Aretusa raconta a Cerere che Pluto li a rapita proserpina; Laterali 4
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Ceres stands at left leaning upon chariot and holding torch in her right hand. She listens to nymph, Arethusa, who reclines upon her. At right edge, parts of two drawings of kneeling figures.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceres is told of the Rape of Proserpina", 1812.
1812. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on light brown laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3282.
